sentences.en: Are you normal if you are single and unmarried?
sentences.cn: 单身而未婚的人是正常人 吗 ?

sentences.en: Everyone thought he had died unmarried, but that was not true.
sentences.cn: 大家都以为他没结婚就死了, 可是那不是真的.

sentences.en: He spent rest of his life ( unmarried ) in vicinity of Concord.
sentences.cn: 他终身未娶,后来一直住在康考德附近.

sentences.en: However, most unmarried people have to find their own dates.
sentences.cn: 但大多数未婚者必须为自己寻找约会的机会.

sentences.en: Is he able, with a good conscience, to remain unmarried?
sentences.cn: 他能以良好的道德, 保持独身 吗 ?

sentences.en: More and more unmarried people prefer to live with their families.
sentences.cn: 越来越多未婚的人喜欢和家人一起生活.

sentences.en: Other changes include more tolerant attitudes to unmarried couples having children.
sentences.cn: 其他变化包括对非婚夫妇生育更为宽容的态度。

sentences.en: She disapproves of unmarried couples living together.
She left no will and was unmarried.
sentences.cn: 她没留下遗嘱,也没结过婚.

sentences.en: The unmarried son may leave for stretches of city work, but he is bound to return.
sentences.cn: 未婚儿子可以去城市打短工, 但他一定要回来.

sentences.en: They both bewailed their misfortune at being young, unmarried returned students.
sentences.cn: 两人慨叹不幸身为青年未婚留学生的麻烦.

sentences.en: They refused to rent an apartment to an unmarried couple.
sentences.cn: 他们拒绝把公寓租给未婚情侣。

sentences.en: Though he is forty, he is still unmarried.
sentences.cn: 尽管他已经40岁了, 但还是独身.

sentences.en: Today, we no longer gasp when we hear a teenage girl is pregnant or whisper about unmarried couples who live together.
sentences.cn: 今天，我们听到未成年少女怀孕时不会再感到惊讶，也不会再去私下谈论谁谁未婚同居。
